title: Trans activists march on state capitols nationwide as cloud of Nashville Christian school shooting looms
description: Trans activists have been demonstrating at state capitol buildings to protest legislation placing restrictions on gender transition procedures for children.

title: Louisiana State University gymnast Elena Arenas shows off backflips as LSU Tigers advance in NCAA tournament
description: Louisiana State University (LSU) gymnast Elena Arenas posted a Tiktok video of her performing two perfect back flips on the spot, as the team gears up for the NCAA regional finals.

title: Dad asks Reddit if he should let his teen daughter meet a boy from Instagram in person
description: A man turned to Reddit's parenting subreddit to ask if he should let his teen daughter meet another teen in real life after they corresponded on Instagram and Snapchat and talked by phone.

title: 'Hands off my stove': New group pushes back against gas stove bans sweeping nation
description: A newly formed non-profit is bringing the spirit of "don't tread on me" to the kitchen, taking a stand against an ongoing campaign to ban gas-powered stoves.

title: Author Judy Blume blasts Roald Dahl censorship, defends controversial ‘Gender Queer’ book being in schools
description: Author Judy Blume recently slammed Puffin U.K.'s decision to do a politically correct language update to Roald Dahl's classic children's books.

title: Pro-Trump social media influencer Douglass Mackey convicted of election interference
description: Social media influencer Douglass Mackey was convicted of election interference for his posts during the 2016 election between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton.

title: Border agents find 58 migrants crammed in Penske truck in alleged human smuggling
description: Border agents uncovered an human smuggling incident that included 58 migrants crammed in a Penske truck and arrested the driver, who will face federal charges

title: Washington cold case victim identified decades after fishermen found naked, dismembered body floating in river
description: Spokane, Washington, police identified a woman's body that was found with her head, hands and feet cut off in 1984 in February, the department said this week.

title: Steelers prank NFL world with Snoop Dogg tweet on April Fools' Day

title: Biden admin allows immigrants to select gender identity other than birth sex after 'Trans Day of Visibility'
description: USCIS is now accepting the gender identity of those seeking immigration benefits even if the gender marker doesn't match up with the marker found on their documents.

title: Former Moscow correspondent predicts what awaits detained Wall Street Journal reporter in Russia
description: Former NPR Moscow correspondent Lucian Kim weighs what Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich could face having been charged with espionage in Russia.

title: LSU cheerleaders help get stuck basketball down during Final Four matchup

title: Biden visits University of Pennsylvania campus for the first time since classified documents controversy
description: President Biden visited the campus of the University of Pennsylvania for the first time since the discovery of classified documents at the Penn Biden Center in D.C.

title: South Carolina’s Dawn Staley on name being suggested for Temple job: ‘Don't want to coach in the men's game’
description: When asked about her name being floated for the head coach opening at Temple University, South Carolina head coach Dawn Staley said she didn't want to coach in the men's game.

description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis told the audience at the Pennsylvania Leadership Conference on Saturday that Republicans have "left the Democratic Party for dead" in Florida.

title: Black hole jet from newly-classified galaxy changes direction toward Earth, astronomers say
description: A group of international researchers said a jet from a galaxy with a supermassive black hole at its center had changed direction and is pointing at us.

title: Kelly Clarkson rips ex-husband Brandon Blackstock in show's karaoke segment

description: Sen. Marsha Blackburn, Tennessee Republican, hosted a women's forum that included Riley Gaines, Carrie Severino, Pam Bondi and others earlier in March; they spoke of standing up to a woke culture.

description: Patrick Mahomes wasn't about to be pressured by his teammate into paying for Twitter Blue and gave a nice, punchy reason why he won't pay for it.

description: Tori Spelling stepped out wearing a bedazzled eye patch as she attended an event on Monday night. She explained last week that she had a corneal ulcer.

description: The U.S. military launched a major invasion of the Japanese home island of Okinawa, one of the deadliest battles of World War II, on this day in history, April 1, 1945.
